revision.text: ==Central Nahuatl== [[File:Color icon green.svg|thumb|Xoxoctic]] ===Alternative forms=== * {{sense|Amecameca}} {{l|nhn|xoxohuic}} ===Etymology=== From {{der|nhn|nci|xoxoctic}}. ===Adjective=== {{head|nhn|adjective}} # [[green]]. [[Category:Milpa Alta Central Nahuatl]] [[Category:nhn:Colors]] ---- ==Classical Nahuatl== ===Adjective=== {{head|nci|adjective|head=xoxoctic}} # [[green]]. ====Descendants==== * {{desc|nhn|xoxoctic}} ===References=== * Andrews, J. Richard. (2003) ''Workbook for Introduction to Classical Nahuatl, Revised Edition'', University of Oklahoma Press. * Karttunen, Frances. (1983) ''An Analytical Dictionary of Nahuatl'', University of Texas Press. * Lockhart, James. (2001) ''Nahuatl as Written'', Stanford University Press. [[Category:Classical Nahuatl terms using regularized orthography]] {{c|nci|Colors}}
